com.mapgroup.classificator.tree

Class DecisionTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mapgroup.classificator.tree.DecisionTree
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DecisionTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class represents the decision tree as a set of sub-trees.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • determineBestSplitNode

        private SplitNode determineBestSplitNode(Data trainingSet,
                               int begin,
                               int end)
                                  throws NoSplitException
        This function allows you to get one that, relative to the sub-set of training and the training set currently analyzed, turns out to be the node that allows you to have more information gain. In this way there is the possibility of generating a split which provides a gain of information than the other, thereby improving the process of construction of the decision tree.
        Parameters:
        trainingSet - full data Set
        begin - first extreme of the training subset
        end - last extreme of the training subset
        Returns:
        a node with the highest information gain
        Throws:
        NoSplitException

      • getNumberOfChildren

        public int getNumberOfChildren()
        Returns the number of subtree of this decision tree.
        Returns:
        number of subtree

      • getRoot

        public Node getRoot()
        Returns the root node of this decision tree.
        Returns:
        decision's tree root node, null if the tree isn't created

      • isLeaf

        private boolean isLeaf(Data trainingSet,
             int begin,
             int end,
             int numberOfExamplesPerLeaf)
        Checks if the current subset could be associated to a leaf node verifying if the subset's cardinality is lower than the minimum value and the class attribute values' frequency.
        Parameters:
        trainingSet - whole training set
        begin - starter index of the training subset
        end - last index of the training subset
        numberOfExamplesPerLeaf - maximum number of children for the node
        Returns:
        true if the current subset verify the leaf node condition, false otherwise

      • learnTree

        private void learnTree(Data trainingSet,
             int begin,
             int end,
             int numberOfExamplesPerLeaf)
        Generates a sub-tree with the subset specified in input creating a leaf node or a split node. In this case determines the best node for the specified subset.

        For this node associates a subtree having as root the selected node and a number of subtree equals to the number of child generated from the split operation.

        Recursively, for each decision tree in childTree this method will be invoked in order to start the learning operation on a reduced training subset of the current traning set.

        In the learning process, if the split node doesn't create any children, this node will become a leaf node.

        Parameters:
        trainingSet - whole training set
        begin - starter index of the training subset
        end - last index of the training subset
        numberOfExamplesPerLeaf - maximum number of children for the node

      • loadTree

        public static DecisionTree loadTree(java.lang.String fileName)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Load the serialized decision tree contained in a file with the specified name fileName.
        Parameters:
        fileName - filename in which the decision is serialized
        Returns:
        the loaded decision tree
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - - if some errors occurred working with the file
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - - if an invalid class was read

        Serializes this decision tree in a file with the specified name fileName.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
